newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suez to pay 24.60 fr/shr in Lyonnaise deal.
newsitem.headline: Suez to pay 24.60 fr/shr in Lyonnaise deal.

text.p: French holding company Cie de Suez said on Friday it would pay a net dividend of 24.60 francs per share, making a payout totalling 3.8 billion francs.
Suez will ask a special shareholders meeting to be held on June 11 to approve a planned merger with utility group Lyonnaise des Eaux, it said in a statement.
Suez will also ask for approval for the cancellation of the five percent it holds itself in its share capital, it said.
The cash-only dividend, which is equivalent to 36.90 francs ($6.37) per share on a gross basis, will be paid on June 26, the statement said.
The cancellation of Suez's treasury stock was aimed at reducing the potential dilution of capital and to give long-term support to the share price, it said.
A separate statement will be made jointly by Suez and Lyonnaise on the merger, it said.
Lyonnaise and Suez are merging to create a group with estimated combined annual sales of 200 billion francs and a market capitalisation of 75 billion francs.
